item.description:
This will be the next-to-last of our bimonthly beginner seminars for the season, and the last one on Introduction to Bicycle Commuting until next spring. The beginner seminar series is taught by experienced members of the Portland Bicycle Commuting Meetup. A variety of general topics will be covered, such as bike requirements, carrying stuff, logistics, and a bit about Traffic Safety. (Traffic Safety will be covered in more detail in its own seminar next month.)

This month's seminar will be taught by John Brooking, founder of the Portland Bicycle Commuting Meetup, and a daily year-round bicycle commuter for just over 6 years now. John is also a past member of the Portland Bicycle/Pedestrian Advisory Committee and is a board member of the Bicycle Coalition of Maine.

For more online information about beginning bike commuting, see

  • Our Getting Started page
  • Our Carrying Things by Bike page
  • Our Bike Trails and Maps page
  • Our PowerPoint presentation on the topic
item.name: Introduction to Bicycle Commuting
